ygData.subject: Various
ygData.msgSnippet: LOL... every so often I do my various posts. First of all... human monk vs Iskar monk. Let me do this. Human monk s advantage-- can travel in a
ygData.messageBody:
LOL... every so often I do my various
posts.<br><br>First of all... human monk vs Iskar monk. Let me do
this.<br><br>Human monk's advantage-- can travel in a lot of
areas.<br><br>Iskars are pretty limited on cities and banks.<br>1)
Iskars regen faster and usually deal a bit more damage
than humans<br>2) Iskars see a bit better and swim at
master levels starting out.<br>3) Iskar monks get forage
starting out.<br>4) Iskar monks start with dual wield. (I
forget if human monks do or not. But they sure
do.)<br><br>Alright, now Necro vs SK<br><br>Given 2 mins prep time to
prep each other... necro wins every time. Now this all
is assuming PVP spells are memmed rather than Party
spells. Necro's have a bigger pet, can slow and dot, and
fear better. The SK has HT but that's not going to
save him if the necro fears, slows, and dots him well.
Plus necro's have a bunch of other utility spells.
<br><br>Now this all is assuming certain things. I'm not a
PVP player so I could play a Necro (which is also a
class I don't like playing) and get smoked by an SK.
This is assuming equal levels of knowledge of PVP,
preparation, and levels. <br><br>Course, an SK with a lot of
pumices and other things might not lose... it's just
he'll have to be better at playing than the necro.
(Hey, if a Warrior can win 8 in a Tournament at a Con--
you know any class can win. Warriors are supposed--
supposed-- to be the worse pvp. And yes, PVP stinks to group
with in Non-pvp servers.)<br><br>shooman out
